H0.text: Blood type is determined by specific antigens on the surface of red blood cells, which is important in cases of transfusion.

H1.text: Blood count is determined by specific antigens on the surface of red blood cells, which is important in cases of transfusion.

H2.text: Blood amount is determined by specific antigens on the surface of red blood cells, which is important in cases of transfusion.

H3.text: Blood form is determined by specific antigens on the surface of red blood cells, which is important in cases of transfusion.

A4.text: Blood type (also known as a blood group) is a classification of blood based on the presence and absence of antibodies and inherited antigenic substances on the surface of red blood cells (RBCs).

A5.text: The antigens are present on the red blood cells, and the antibodies in the serum.
